cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles east of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast just off the Florida/Georgia coastline, then accelerating northeastward and passing near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks before heading offshore of the Mid-Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from east-central Florida northward to the North Carolina Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of gusty winds possible Sunday as the center passes offshore; chance of sustained tropical-storm force winds is under 10%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected; only minor water level rises possible along the beaches during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Generally light rain showers, totals less than 1 inch expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along area beaches beginning late Saturday and persisting through Sunday.
